Title: Real Estate Data Analyst
Description:
The Americas Real Estate Data Analyst is individually responsible for creating and managing data analytics utilizing software applications, to frame, structure, and prioritize Real Estate strategies by comprehensive data sets and mining for usable information. Utilizing a developed knowledge of data processing and advanced experience with data software programs, such as Excel, Power BI, Oracle, SAP, and Salesforce, create graphs, infographics, and other visualization methods to “tell a story,” effectively.

As part of a team, the Americas Real Estate Data Analyst will collaborate with visual content creators and presenters to build compelling presentations and reports, based on recommendations and findings, creating thought-provoking stakeholder and executive leadership engagement for key project initiatives.

We are looking to add to our team a creative problem solver who can create opportunities for improvement, diversification, and optimization, through data-based arguments and solutions to solve complex problems. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply.

Key Responsibilities:

Create tools to measure productivity, accuracy, cost-effectiveness and efficiency of real estate operations and project management
Analyze and assess the current Real Estate portfolio, as well as new and ongoing transactions
Evaluate appropriate need, location, size, and purpose of offices based on analysis of multiple factors and data points
Synthesize key messages into business solutions and communicate effectively to leadership
Create, analyze and present financial and budgetary reports to include recommendations to leadership
Collect and analyze user requirements and ideal system business intelligence data
Performs business process workflow, analysis, and reengineering through automation
Ad-Hoc Reporting and Analysis
Assist with financial and business-related research and cooperate with other departme
Commercial/Corporate Real Estate, Financial Services, or Consulting experience
Experience in database development and maintenance
Experience with Oracle suite
1-3 years of experience performing data analysis
Strong research skills
High integrity, self-motivated, and strong work ethic
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
Ability to connect disparate systems together to share and utilize large amounts of data into actionable information
Advanced technical skills including proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Access, and PowerPoint
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to create and interpret financial models
Ability to multi-task, prioritize completing projects and time-sensitive deliverables within a fast-paced work environment
Creative and strategic thinker
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills
Executive presence and presentation capabilities.

The base pay for this position is $70.000-85,000.

Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Medidata provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a commission under the terms of applicable plan documents, while many of Medidata’s non-sales positions are eligible for annual bonuses. Additionally, Medidata provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most and should help you care for those who matter most. For that reason, we provide an array of options to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life.

Equal Employment OpportunityIn order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at Medidata are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Medidata is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. Medidata will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law. Covid StatementOur Company requires all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to provide documentation of full vaccination, unless qualified for a medical, religious or state-required accommodation or otherwise exempt consistent with applicable law. Although accommodation requests will be considered (and granted where appropriate/possible), it may be determined that a candidate is unable to adequately perform the essential functions of the position without imposing an undue hardship due to customer requirements, staffing needs, or other business reasons. Definition of full-vaccination: Employees are considered to be fully vaccinated two weeks after their second dose in a 2-dose series or two weeks after a single-dose vaccine.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
At ZoomInfo we encourage creativity, value innovation, demand teamwork, expect accountability and cherish results. If you are a take charge, take initiative, get stuff done individual we want to talk to you! We have high aspirations for the company and are looking for the right people to help fulfill the dream. We strive to continually improve every aspect of the company and use cutting edge technologies and processes to delight our customers and rapidly increase revenues.




ZoomInfo is looking for a Business Analyst to join our outstanding Data Product Management Team. This position will be working with the Product Manager to manage the development and prioritization of ZoomInfo’s internal algorithms that help ingest, normalize, and publish sales intelligence data. The person in this role will be responsible for working closely with internal stakeholders to ensure our internal rules-based and data science algorithms are making decisions that result in the highest quality Sales Intelligence Data. Intent data is the newest product for Zoominfo and it determines customers intent based on web browsing and clicks.




Job Duties And Responsibilities




Define, track, and communicate metrics to help understand how intent initiatives are meeting company objectives
Lead analytics projects to help improve the coverage & accuracy of our intent data
Research and identify potential new intent data improvements
Own ongoing improvements to Zoominfo’s intent taxonomy in coordination with our custom topic team
Work with the Product Manager and Development team to create and groom tickets




Requirements




A 4 year degree from a reputable university, STEM field preferred
Open and willing to learn about intent, software development life cycle and product management
Ability to move fast and adapt quickly to changing business priorities
Ability to plan, prioritize, and excel in developing a dynamic high paced cross functional team environment
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Self driven and motivated
Experience with SQL, Excel and BI / data visualizations tools required




About Us




For over a decade, ZoomInfo has helped companies achieve their most important objective: profitable growth. Backed by the world's most comprehensive B2B database, our platform puts sales and marketing professionals in position to identify, connect, and engage with qualified prospects.




Our mission is to provide every company with a 360-degree view of their ideal customer, empowering each phase of their go-to-market strategy and driving their ability to hit their number.




The US base salary range for this position is $65,600 - $87,740 + bonus + equity + benefits.




Actual compensation offered will be based on factors such as the candidate’s work location, qualifications, skills, experience and/or training. Your recruiter can share more information about the specific salary range for your desired work location during the hiring process.




We want our employees and their families to thrive. In addition to comprehensive benefits we offer holistic mind, body and lifestyle programs designed for overall well-being. Learn more about ZoomInfo benefits here.

#AP1

Title: Lead Data Analyst- Customer and Financial Analytics
Description:
The Opportunity

We are looking for an analytical, detail oriented and collaborative individual to join our Financial and Customer analytics team. As lead data analyst, you will act as a trusted advisor working cross-functionally across Finance, Customer Health, Business Ops, as well as senior leadership. In this role you will be responsible for deep financial and business analysis on our business performance, providing visibility into revenue and expense drivers, customer health and behavior, current pricing and packaging strategies in an effort to best support our customers.

About The Team

The business intelligence team enables all groups across the organization to harness the power of data to make our customers more secure and drive growth for Rapid7. The team works as collaborative partners who provide actionable, accessible, and relevant data, insights, and predictive analytics.

About the Role

The ideal candidate will be an inquisitive learner with a passion for data and analytics who can collaborate with stakeholders across functional areas to review and optimize reporting, analytics, and data structure/data capture all while aligning to corporate objectives. This role requires a mixture of business acumen and technical expertise in SQL, and Tableau, along with an ability to build strong partnerships with business partners.

Collaborate with Finance, Customer Health, Business Ops, Product, and Senior Leadership teams to conduct deep financial and business analysis on our business performance, providing visibility into revenue and expense drivers, customer health and behavior, current pricing and packaging strategies in an effort to best support our customers
Understand existing customer economics, margins and utilization to support proposed changes to pricing models
Provide clear visualizations and present analyses to management and executive-level stakeholders, using Business Intelligence tools and predictive analytics to drive key decisions
Drive consistency in reporting and analysis across the company, reinforcing process, increasing visibility, and acting as a key point of communication between stakeholder teams
Develop in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business uses of data
Coach and mentor junior team members to become savvy with Tableau and visualization.
Advance BI team & corporate goals, promoting a data-oriented culture, insight generation and enablement of end-users

In this role you will bring

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Business, Economics, or related discipline required, Masters preferred.
At least 8 years work experience in a role that required regular business analytics; high tech, software, or mgmt. consulting company preferred.
At least 5 years of hands-on experience in Tableau with strong data visualization skills.
8 years of hands-on proficiency with SQL.
Strong business acumen, possessing the ability to understand cross-functional trends, and how those trends impact corporate KPIs; prior experience in an operational role a plus
Fast learner with high attention to detail and possess a passion for data, data quality & business analytics

​

We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. Teams reflecting a variety of backgrounds and professional experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please don’t be shy - apply today.




About Rapid7

Rapid7 (NASDAQ: RPD) helps organizations across the globe protect what matters most so innovation can thrive in an increasingly connected world. Our comprehensive technology, services, and community-focused research simplify the complex for security teams, helping them reduce vulnerabilities, monitor for malicious behavior, be in 10 places at once, and shut down attacks. We’re on a mission to make security solutions easier to use and access so we can bring safety and resilience to more people. With more than 10,000 customers across 140+ countries, Rapid7 is a leader in cybersecurity that has earned numerous industry accolades and recognition for our technology and culture.

#linkedInHybrid

Hybrid- Boston ( 3x days in office)







All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Show more Show less
HTML:
The Opportunity

We are looking for an analytical, detail oriented and collaborative individual to join our Financial and Customer analytics team. As lead data analyst, you will act as a trusted advisor working cross-functionally across Finance, Customer Health, Business Ops, as well as senior leadership. In this role you will be responsible for deep financial and business analysis on our business performance, providing visibility into revenue and expense drivers, customer health and behavior, current pricing and packaging strategies in an effort to best support our customers.

About The Team

The business intelligence team enables all groups across the organization to harness the power of data to make our customers more secure and drive growth for Rapid7. The team works as collaborative partners who provide actionable, accessible, and relevant data, insights, and predictive analytics.

About the Role

The ideal candidate will be an inquisitive learner with a passion for data and analytics who can collaborate with stakeholders across functional areas to review and optimize reporting, analytics, and data structure/data capture all while aligning to corporate objectives. This role requires a mixture of business acumen and technical expertise in SQL, and Tableau, along with an ability to build strong partnerships with business partners.

  • Collaborate with Finance, Customer Health, Business Ops, Product, and Senior Leadership teams to conduct deep financial and business analysis on our business performance, providing visibility into revenue and expense drivers, customer health and behavior, current pricing and packaging strategies in an effort to best support our customers
  • Understand existing customer economics, margins and utilization to support proposed changes to pricing models
  • Provide clear visualizations and present analyses to management and executive-level stakeholders, using Business Intelligence tools and predictive analytics to drive key decisions
  • Drive consistency in reporting and analysis across the company, reinforcing process, increasing visibility, and acting as a key point of communication between stakeholder teams
  • Develop in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business uses of data
  • Coach and mentor junior team members to become savvy with Tableau and visualization.
  • Advance BI team & corporate goals, promoting a data-oriented culture, insight generation and enablement of end-users

In this role you will bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Business, Economics, or related discipline required, Masters preferred.
  • At least 8 years work experience in a role that required regular business analytics; high tech, software, or mgmt. consulting company preferred.
  • At least 5 years of hands-on experience in Tableau with strong data visualization skills.
  • 8 years of hands-on proficiency with SQL.
  • Strong business acumen, possessing the ability to understand cross-functional trends, and how those trends impact corporate KPIs; prior experience in an operational role a plus
  • Fast learner with high attention to detail and possess a passion for data, data quality & business analytics

​

We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. Teams reflecting a variety of backgrounds and professional experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please don’t be shy - apply today.

Title: Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description Summary

As a member of the Portfolio Analytics Group the principal job function of the Portfolio Data Analyst is to gather information and data regarding primary, secondary and direct investments and track this information.

Responsibilities

Portfolio Reporting: 70%

Track confidential underlying portfolio data including IPOs, M&A and buyout company metrics
Reconcile data to quarterly financial statements
Upload checklists and relevant backup into document storage system


Fund Reporting: 10%

Prepare quarterly fund reporting package for review


Quarterly Receipt of Financial Statements: 5%

Request/track receipt of quarterly financial statements and other relevant partnership information


Capital Calls/Distribution Process: 10%

Track capital calls and distributions
Track cash flow adjustments/reconcile issues with accounting


Miscellaneous Portfolio Analytics: 5%

System Testing, as needed
Download benchmarking reports
Assist Closing Coordinator
Assist Operations Assistant
Complete projects as requested by upper management


Education

BS/BA or equivalent

Work Experience

0-2 years

Title: Analyst Data Visualization
Description:
Address: USA-MA-Quincy-1385 Hancock Street

Store Code: HRIS (2760842)

Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company’s 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, currently providing services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provides industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued. For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com.

Primary Purpose:

The Data Visualization Specialist is responsible to work with leadership of RBS and our retail Brands as well as multiple stakeholders to deliver quantitative and qualitative metrics, diagnostic/predictive analytics, and visual dashboards. This role will create actionable insights to ensure growth of the business and proactively identify at-risk associate metrics, identify revenue opportunities, improve business forecasting and work processes. This role will “tell the story” with visualizations and analytics while playing a pivotal role in leading the development of a self-service ecosystem to provide long-term scalability for business ownership of data and metrics.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Create a data-centric organizational environment that allows for empowerment of users to create visualizations across the organization.
Develop, package and present business intelligence recommendations to the senior leadership team through a combination of qualitative and quantitative feedback.
Analyze key data, industry trends, and strategic objectives to identify areas for opportunity.
Proactively and independently analyze data and connect various data points to identify business issues and recommend creative, innovative data-driven solutions.
Create regular, automated reporting assets that enable effective storytelling and empower decision making across the organization.
Collaborate with leadership – provide meaningful and credible feedback on reporting capabilities and data availability.
Work with our retail Brand teams and RBS to define opportunities to innovate by implementing new data analytic platforms and processes.
Educate business leaders to be more data driven and utilize data to transform the organizational business units to develop plans based on data.
Act as a consultant to business leaders and drive competencies within the organization related to the use of data and metrics in decision making and creating business solutions.
Remain abreast on industry trends related to BI and drive a data driven culture with senior leadership by developing solutions and change management for leaders to embed in their organizations.
Lead optimization and use of the Power BI platform and processes on how data is/can be utilized in the organization.
Drive DE&I initiatives through analyzing data and creating visualizations that build the business case for change.
Create and edit visual content including maps, charts, and graphs.
Transform data sets, quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals.
Provide visual, technical and editorial guidance related to business initiatives.
Be the subject matter expert and trusted partner supporting the analytical needs of the leadership teams of the Brands and RBS.
Build relationships across teams to leverage and extend existing analytical research
Deploy advanced applications of descriptive and predictive analytics to enhance the continual improvement of business results.
Understand the business stakeholders’ objectives, the metrics that are the most important to them, and how they measure their performance.
Maintain a high level of visibility in the organization by working with senior leaders to drive cultural change across a wide spectrum of data disciplines.
Stay current on data visualization best practices in the field.


Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Business
10+ years of experience in data visualization, creating visuals including demonstrable design knowledge, such as layout, typography, color, interaction design and fluency with standard data presentation and visualization tools (Ex: Power BI)
5+ years consultant skills
Ability to communicate with highly technical associates and transform content for end users
Ability to understand problems by using data and develop storytelling visuals
Deep understanding of Data and Analytics, including full life-cycle development
Strong analytical and prioritization skills
Ability to effectively communicate across multiple senior levels within the organization
Experience analyzing high volumes of data for multiple purposes in a dynamic environment
Experience with industry standard tools to create impactful reports, visualizations, and interactive dashboards


Preferred Qualifications:

Previous experience in a retail/shared services environment.
Excellent visualization skills
Strong cartography skills
Expertise with charting and other data visualization techniques
Experience with cloud platform data warehouse technologies.
Track record in driving a data driven culture across business units


#RBSJOBS #ZR

Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.

If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com.

Job Requisition: 264509_external_USA-MA-Quincy_8232022

Title: Strategy Data Analyst
Description:
About Generate Biomedicines

Generate Biomedicines is a new kind of therapeutics company – existing at the intersection of machine learning, biological engineering, and medicine – pioneering Generative Biology™ to create breakthrough medicines where novel therapeutics are computationally generated, instead of being discovered. Generate has built a machine learning-powered biomedicines platform with the potential to generate new drugs across a wide range of biologic modalities. This platform represents a potentially fundamental shift in what is possible in the field of biotherapeutic development.

We pursue this audacious vision because we believe in the unique and revolutionary power of generative biology to radically transform the lives of billions, with an outsized opportunity for patients in need. We are seeking collaborative, relentless problem solvers that share our passion for impact to join us!

Generate was founded in 2018 by Flagship Pioneering and has received over $420 million in funding, providing the resources to rapidly scale the organization. The Company has offices in Somerville, and Andover with approximately 200 employees.

The Role:

As part of a growing Data Strategy team, the Strategy Data Analyst will have a high-impact role in supporting Generate’s platform for AI-driven protein therapeutic discovery. In this role, your mission will be to synthesize disparate thought streams into a cohesive understanding of the problem, what the data means, what Generate’s platform needs, and where the impact could be.

The ideal candidate is quantitatively rigorous and can understand and integrate various types of structured and unstructured data across multiple departments and levels of the organization. They are highly adaptable to change, an excellent communicator, and able to influence key decision makers. If you enjoy using your technical skills and systems-level thinking to build, improve, and value data, and have an interest in working at the interface of life science and technology, this role may be for you.

Key Responsibilities

Lead operational data analysis: model data flows across platform processes, develop solutions to address data gaps, and assess the health and quality of Generate’s data assets
Build new tools: create new data products to improve connectivity across the platform and build visualizations of data-generating processes
Value Generate’s data: quantify trends in the volume, velocity, and usage of Generate’s data assets, and work with business partners to drive the platform in high-value directions
Regularly present analytical results and strategy proposals to Data and Platform Strategy team members and to business partners, including senior leaders


Qualifications

Minimum Bachelors degree in a quantitative discipline (computer science, engineering, or similar)
3+ years experience in management consulting, data strategy or data scientist roles
Experience in healthcare or life science consulting
Experience in biotech/pharma is a plus
Data science (model building) or data engineering (pipeline building) experience is a plus


Skills

Proficiency with one or more programming languages, including Python, SQL, or similar
Experience with dashboarding and business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) is preferred
Proficiency with one or more large scale data technologies, such as Spark, Snowflake, or similar is a plus
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals
Entrepreneurial spirit with the desire to work in a fast-paced startup environment
Ability to be independent in interactions with business partners, in managing meetings, and in managing simultaneous projects


Flagship Pioneering and our ecosystem companies are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

COVID Safety:

Generate Biomedicines enforces a mandatory vaccination policy for COVID-19. All employees must be fully vaccinated and have received a booster. The purpose of this policy is to safeguard the health of our employees, their families, and the community at large from infectious disease that may be reduced by vaccinations. The company will make exceptions to this policy if required by applicable law and will consider requests for an exemption from this policy due to a medical reason, or because of a sincerely held religious belief, or any other exemptions that may be recognized by applicable.

Recruitment & Staffing Agencies: Flagship Pioneering and its affiliated Flagship Lab companies (collectively, “FSP”) do not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than candidates. The submission of unsolicited resumes by recruitment or staffing agencies to FSP or its employees is strictly prohibited unless contacted directly by Flagship Pioneering’s internal Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted by an agency in the absence of a signed agreement will automatically become the property of FSP, and FSP will not owe any referral or other fees with respect thereto.

Title: Quality Data Analyst
Description:
When you join the growing BILH team, you're not just taking a job, you’re making a difference in people’s lives.




Job Type:




Regular




Scheduled Hours:




40




Work Shift:




Day (United States of America)




Quality and Patient Safety




Job Description:




Primary Responsibilities




Serve as system manager and report writer on rL Solutions Safety Reporting




(STARS) and Patient Complaints database.




Serves as the primary analyst for Vizient CDB and other systems




including Provider Performance and Resource Manager including managing




extracts and reporting.




Serves as the primary analyst for the Medisolv performance measure reporting tool for CMS, MassHealth and Joint Commission measures including managing data extracts, users, reporting and measure submissions and serving as the primary liaison with IS
Serve as a system administrator and report writer on PressGaney Fusion




reporting application.




Works collaboratively with OneIS and Quality and Safety to assure compliance with Promoting Interoperability (PI) and eCQM measures. Manages reporting of




PI/eCQM data to Qualitynet and Joint Commission as required.




Analyses data and compiles reports and analysis from Quality Reporting systems and Clinical Data Registries using both proprietary and industry reporting tools such as Excel and Crystal reports.
Coordinate the retrieval of information and creation of reports from other




systems as directed.




Reviews documentation and analyzes the specifications and requirements




provided by external reporting agencies and designs or customizes database




software applications to meet these needs.




Verify data collected and reported by the department is accurate by performing data validation checks to ascertain accuracy of data entered and reported.
Manages assigned projects, including creating and maintaining work plans, and keeping improvement teams on track to produce deliverables on time.
Develops and tracks project milestones, performance measures, and dashboards.
Performs all steps of analysis: literature search, tool development, data




collection, data analysis and benchmarking, presentation of results.




Facilitate use of statistical techniques to analyze data through Vizient, Excel, and other database software.
Preparing presentation and reports for work teams and leadership groups as directed




Required Qualifications




Verbal, quantitative, and interpersonal skills, generally acquired through the completion of a Bachelor's degree or three to four years relevant Healthcare IT experience.
Healthcare IT, Electronic Health Record or Clinical Data experience preferred.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage multiple projects and reporting deadlines.
Ability to grasp technical information, detail-oriented, with excellent writing, and research and organizational experience.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; Strong definition, analysis, development, and documentation skills.
Ability to understand and graphically display complex numerical data using a variety of graphing tools and present the information to both clinical and non-clinical employees.
Knowledge of project management, quality improvement techniques, statistical analysis methods.
Experience with Clinical Data Registries, rL Solutions, Vizient Clinical Database and Press Ganey desirable but not required.*
Proficiency in Microsoft Office including Outlook, Excel, Powerpoint, and Visio.
Ability to effectively facilitate groups and meet team deadlines remotely.
Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills.




Social/Environmental Requirements:




Normal office
Contact with staff, including clinicians in all hospital areas




FLSA Status:




Exempt




As a health care organization, we have a responsibility to do everything in our power to care for and protect our patients, our colleagues and our communities. Beth Israel Lahey Health requires that all staff be vaccinated against influenza (flu) and COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Learn more about this requirement.




More than 35,000 people working together. Nurses, doctors, technicians, therapists, researchers, teachers and more, making a difference in patients' lives. Your skill and compassion can make us even stronger.




Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Jr. Data Systems Support Analyst
Description:
JR. DATA SYSTEMS ANALYST

REGION ONE SUPPORT CONTRACT

Position Description

STG International is seeking qualified Jr. Data Systems Analyst candidates to work full-time to support the Office of Head Start Region I Regional Office located in Boston, Massachusetts. The Jr. Data Systems Analyst will demonstrate a positive attitude and a strong work ethic to become an integral member of the STGi Support Team.

The Jr. Data Systems Analyst will be responsible for the following tasks:

Support data entry, HSES uploads, and report/form creation for the Region One Grantee ACCESS database.
Maintain tracking of monitoring concerns outside of regularly scheduled Aligned Monitoring.
Complete monthly enrollment and issues reports for Program Specialists.
Maintain shared calendars and coordinate events for the Regional Office.
Develop reports, correspondence, and presentations to include spreadsheets, Work documents, and PowerPoints, as assigned.
Generate, review and upload Funding Guidance Letters into HSES for Grantees.
Complete annual review of PIR, revision to PIR Analysis Report and creation of PIR Reports & Analysis for Program Specialists.
Complete T&TA Review Summary Report for Program Specialists based on review and analysis of grantee self-assessment, CLASS and PIR data, as well as, their annual T&TA Plan.
Serve as Federal Time Keeper including distribution of weekly timesheets for all staff and verification of ITAS data for the Regional Program Manager.
Participate in special projects as assigned by Project Manager and/or Regional Program Manager (i.e. pre-reading of Change of Scope applications, paneling for competitive grant application, participate in follow reviews with Program Specialists, etc.).
Serve as a back-up for Funds Planning Grant Actions.

Required Skills

Ideal candidate will have the following minimum qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in human services, business, or related field; experience may be substituted for education. Minimum Education: AA/AS in related field with at least two (2) years’ experience at a high level administrative position
Advanced level experience with Microsoft Products: Work, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, ACCESS, Explore; ability to use current webinar technology and audio conferencing
Strong organizational skills and the ability to track multi-faceted projects over an extended period of time
Ability to prioritize and manage workloads and deadlines
Ability to maintain a professional demeanor at all times, including maintaining confidentiality
Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly, both orally and in writing
Ability to work successfully in a team environment
Ability to be flexible in response to changing needs and priorities of the office

Required Experience

Preferred qualifications include:

Working knowledge of the current laws, regulations & policies that govern Head Start/Early Head Start
Demonstrated knowledge of and experience with the administration of federal grants
Demonstrated knowledge of and experience with Early Childhood programs, with a preference for Head Start/Early Head Start programs

STG International, Inc (STGi) is a workforce solutions company providing comprehensive healthcare delivery, Head Start and management consulting services and human capital solutions help our clients. Our services and solutions help our clients sustain and enhance their operations to better accomplish their mission.

STGi offers a competitive benefits package which includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k with company match and a generous PTO policy.

STG International, Inc. is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

Title: Data Analytics Professional
Description:
Job Title: Data Analytics Professional




Job Location: Nationwide




Job Type: Full Time




Working Hours: 8 hrs. /day




Job Description




Join Our Team… at Cogent University, we take pride in creating the next generation of Data Analytics. Complete eight weeks of Data Analytics training, and then your path to success begins as a Data Analytics Professional. We are dedicated towards fulfilling the IT needs of our clients.




Why Cogent for Data Analytics




No upfront cost to attend learning programs / a market value of over $25K and guaranteed job placement
100% Virtual
Everyday classes and sessions
Industry leading trainers with Fortune 500 experience
Dedicated Post-Training support including: Resume Prep, Interview preparation and job placement.
Dedicated Team focused on identifying your dream job. You will spend ZERO time worrying about searching and applying for jobs.
Access to our Cutting-Edge Learning Management System (LMS) providing you 24/7 access to all course related material
Access to our popular ‘Employer Showcase’ sessions providing you access to exclusive information about the Data industry from employers across the US.
Train alongside like-minded individuals and form long-lasting relationships
An opportunity to work on internal Data Analytic projects via our InCights Division
Industry leading compensation, performance bonus and profit sharing




What You Will Learn




Key strategic thinking and problem-solving skills enabling you to communicate data so that all key Stakeholders can understand.
Tableau Visualizations for Analytics Presentations and Data Understanding
Framing Business Problems and Structuring the approach
Data Wrangling by understanding Extract Transform and Load Concepts
Mathematical and Statistical Foundations of solving business problems
Communicating the Analysis and building a Compelling story
Using Python & Excel for Financial Modelling
In depth technical skills through capstone projects




Requirements




Bachelor’s degree (Any Major)
Highly interested in pursuing a career in Data
Understanding of High School Level Math
Strong Critical thinking and Problem-Solving Skills
Good Communication, Collaboration and Presentation Skills
Organization skills and attention to detail
Willingness to learn entry level programming skills in Python
Eligible to be employed anywhere in the US




Preferred Skills – Not Mandatory Requirement




Previous experience working in a data related job
Completed Collegiate Coursework in: Statistics, Mathematics or Data Science related
Courses
1-2 years of professional experience working regularly with Microsoft Office, G-Suite, Design or programming tools




Who Should Apply




Recent College graduates who want to pursue a data-oriented career
Candidates that want to change their career path and pursue a data-oriented career
Candidates who may want to pursue a Data Scientist career in the future




Incorporated in 2003…Cogent is a global, award-winning IT consulting firm specializing in providing digital transformation solutions, data analytics along with top 3% digital talent and innovative workforce solutions to global brands, system integrators, and the public sector. In the last 18 years, Cogent has successfully serviced 65+ Fortune 500 and 50+ federal, state, and local entities.




Our headquarters are in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania within minutes of downtown and the Pittsburgh International Airport.




Social Impact…A proactive, socially responsible corporate program to support “giving back” to the community builds strong leaders.




We are an Equal Opportunity Employer…Cogent does not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, sex, age, non- disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, or any other basis. All our employment decisions are made based on qualification, merit and business need.

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
Must reside in the US – preferably in the Northeast or Mid-Atlantic Regions. Telecommuting permitted. Travel may be required for appropriate technology sessions. Candidates must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship.

What You Will Do

Reporting to the Senior Vice President of Strategic Revenue & Intelligence Solutions, the successful candidate will join a diverse team to develop compelling visualizations, pulling from large data sets and running analysis, to support Enterra’s products

Develop, maintain and enhance commercial quality Power BI reports that clearly visualize the insights and recommendations from Enterra’s solutions.
Configure Power BI for access by clients through various mechanisms including apps, workspaces and embedding.
Work with the Enterra and client teams to customize reports.
Participate in the evolution of Enterra’s solution offerings as a whole.

Responsibilities Include

Analyze requirements from the Enterra team to design appropriate Power BI reports. Strong capacity to convert general requirements to specs and to commit to iterative development to reconcile different project visions or objectives.
Develop reusable, testable, and efficient Power BI reports. This includes:
Identifying and configuring appropriate visuals and dashboards
Implementing tooltips and drill-throughs
Implementing bookmarks
Implementing comprehensive slicers
Implementing Power BI custom themes and other look and feel components
Creating desktop and mobile versions where appropriate.
Integration with data storage solutions that may include databases, data lakes, data warehouses, blob stores, etc. This includes:
Data Integration and testing using both direct query and data imports (using M)
Implement measures using DAX
Understanding the implications of certain data access modes (direct query vs live connections vs import) on the availability of both report authoring features and certain DAX measures.
Design, develop and maintain the deployment pipeline for reports into workspaces and apps. This includes the ability to demonstrate knowledge of (or the capacity to learn quickly) how to:
Deploy and refresh in Power BI service across environments with disparate security configurations;
Automate report/data refresh where necessary;
Enable and maintain incremental refresh;
Trigger refresh via APIs;
Handle conditions where cloud based data services may function as on premises sources for the purposes of refresh.
Configure and manage capacities in Power BI Premium including appropriate authentication, access and other security requirements.
Understand how to provide appropriate access to clients in the absence of Power BI Premium.
Creation and application of test plans for all aspects of reports.
Creation of report documentation.
Participate in regular SDLC activities ranging from estimation, status reporting, SCRUM sessions, design meetings, code reviews etc.

Requirements

Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree.
Minimum of 5 years experience in a similar role in the design, development and deployment of BI solutions with at least 3 years using Microsoft Power BI.
Experience with all aspects of Power BI including DAX, M, data integration, visuals, Power BI custom themes, deployment processes etc.
Creating visualization to create mock-ups by leveraging large data sets
Strong unit test and debugging skills
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools
Experience with data modelling is highly desired
Experience with multiple Power Platform components is highly desired
Experience with one of the following is a plus:
Integrating Python and/or R with Power BI
Row Level Security configuration for Power BI Embedded
Advanced use of calculation groups (and understanding of the potential impacts on report authoring)
Highly organized with the ability to multi-task across tasks and projects within required deadlines.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Ability to clearly communicate complex data and visuals with business and technical personnel with the Enterra team and the client team. This includes documentation, presentations and individual analysis sessions.
Quick learner, self-starter: Looking for a self-starter, who is resourceful with a detail-oriented mindset and uses resources at hand to search for answers and strengthen understanding of projects and tools.
Experience in a client-facing role is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst, Senior Associate
Description:
Data Analyst/ SQL Developer, Alpha Operations




Why this role is important to us




The Alpha Operations team provides Alpha clients with investment, financial, and regulatory reports enabling our clients to make informed, data-driven decisions. The team ensures that the data is delivered to the client in an accurate, complete, and timely manner.




The Data Analyst/ SQL Developer will interact with clients and internal State Street parties to identify the best data validation solutions for the client. The role involves supporting multiple client relationships and client deliverables globally.




What You Will Be Responsible For




Perform daily checks on inbound and outbound data delivery
Develop and maintain data validation and reporting tools
Create SQL-based data validation checks on source and target data to confirm data has correct and expected values
Work independently and collaboratively to identify issues, perform root-cause analysis that would lead to proper and timely issue resolutions
Escalate data and technical related issues to proper teams and track until complete resolution
Contribute to data validation and system enhancement testing efforts
Ensure all activities are compliant with corporate standards
Communicate clearly and effectively with internal and external parties
Adhere to internal procedures and best practices at all times




What You Will Be Responsible For




Degree in computer science, finance, accounting, business, or technology and relevant industry experience
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Strong Technical skills in data management including SQL
Database Management and ETL development experience
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS/ Azure)
Strong communication skills
Self-motivated and adaptable and show initiative and a strong sense of task ownership
Flexibility and willingness to learn and work on new areas of expertise
Asset management experience, including investment operation
Flexible working hours may be required




About State Street




What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.




Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.




Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.




State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.




Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers




Salary Range




$52,000 - $78,520 Annual




The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Job ID: R-710295

Title: Quality Data Analyst
Description:
When you join the growing BILH team, you're not just taking a job, you’re making a difference in people’s lives.




Job Type:




Regular




Scheduled Hours:




40




Work Shift:




Day (United States of America)




Data analyst is responsible for compiling, organizing, and analyzing data to assist in optimal healthcare decision making. Contributes and participates in delivering data and analysis across the enterprise. Data management, development and maintenance of databases, and participating in projects aimed at tracking and improving performance and patient outcomes is a central focus.




Data analyst is a support to the Manager of Analytics and the Executive Director of Quality and Patient Safety. Data analyst supports the organization by accurately measuring performance, understanding key drivers, and identifying opportunities for improvement. This work includes collaborating with clinical and operational leaders to design the right metrics and analyses, as well as developing insights that will inform critical decisions by senior leadership.




Job Description:




Essential Functions:




Assists in the development of monthly Hospital, Departmental, and Unit Quality and Safety dashboards; Patient Experience dashboards and other key dashboards such as Falls, HAPI, Pain, etc.
Creates, reviews and utilizes tracking systems to determine and report status of data and follows up to collect outstanding information and resolve issues
Analyzes clinical and administrative data and applies appropriate statistical and analytical techniques to provide detailed findings and solutions to clinical teams.
Presents statistical concepts in a clear and meaningful way to clinical and administrative staff, by creating reports and presentations on a regular basis.
Provides data and analysis for internal and external reporting to entities such as, The Joint Commission, Department of Public Health, Massachusetts Hospital Association, NDNQI, Board of Registration in Medicine/Nursing, Institute for Healthcare Improvement and other regulatory programs.
Provides quality overview and consistency check on all clinical data.
Assists with event reporting system contract, software upgrades and dashboard management including regular reporting to the organization on status of utilization and trends
Responsible for running quality reports for Medical Staff Office for biannual OPPE/FPPE process.
Utilizes Continuous Improvement efforts within the organization




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree required; Master’s degree preferred
3-5 years related work experience required
Experience with Data Analytics, Excel, Tableau, PowerPoint
Advanced technical computer skills




FLSA Status:




Non-Exempt




As a health care organization, we have a responsibility to do everything in our power to care for and protect our patients, our colleagues and our communities. Beth Israel Lahey Health requires that all staff be vaccinated against influenza (flu) and COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Learn more about this requirement.




More than 35,000 people working together. Nurses, doctors, technicians, therapists, researchers, teachers and more, making a difference in patients' lives. Your skill and compassion can make us even stronger.




Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled
Show more Show less
HTML:
When you join the growing BILH team, you're not just taking a job, you’re making a difference in people’s lives.


Job Type:


Regular


Scheduled Hours:


40


Work Shift:


Day (United States of America)


Data analyst is responsible for compiling, organizing, and analyzing data to assist in optimal healthcare decision making. Contributes and participates in delivering data and analysis across the enterprise. Data management, development and maintenance of databases, and participating in projects aimed at tracking and improving performance and patient outcomes is a central focus.


Data analyst is a support to the Manager of Analytics and the Executive Director of Quality and Patient Safety. Data analyst supports the organization by accurately measuring performance, understanding key drivers, and identifying opportunities for improvement. This work includes collaborating with clinical and operational leaders to design the right metrics and analyses, as well as developing insights that will inform critical decisions by senior leadership.


Job Description:


Essential Functions:


  • Assists in the development of monthly Hospital, Departmental, and Unit Quality and Safety dashboards; Patient Experience dashboards and other key dashboards such as Falls, HAPI, Pain, etc.
  • Creates, reviews and utilizes tracking systems to determine and report status of data and follows up to collect outstanding information and resolve issues
  • Analyzes clinical and administrative data and applies appropriate statistical and analytical techniques to provide detailed findings and solutions to clinical teams.
  • Presents statistical concepts in a clear and meaningful way to clinical and administrative staff, by creating reports and presentations on a regular basis.
  • Provides data and analysis for internal and external reporting to entities such as, The Joint Commission, Department of Public Health, Massachusetts Hospital Association, NDNQI, Board of Registration in Medicine/Nursing, Institute for Healthcare Improvement and other regulatory programs.
  • Provides quality overview and consistency check on all clinical data.
  • Assists with event reporting system contract, software upgrades and dashboard management including regular reporting to the organization on status of utilization and trends
  • Responsible for running quality reports for Medical Staff Office for biannual OPPE/FPPE process.
  • Utilizes Continuous Improvement efforts within the organization


Qualifications


  • Bachelor's degree required; Master’s degree preferred
  • 3-5 years related work experience required
  • Experience with Data Analytics, Excel, Tableau, PowerPoint
  • Advanced technical computer skills


FLSA Status:


Non-Exempt


As a health care organization, we have a responsibility to do everything in our power to care for and protect our patients, our colleagues and our communities. Beth Israel Lahey Health requires that all staff be vaccinated against influenza (flu) and COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Learn more about this requirement.


More than 35,000 people working together. Nurses, doctors, technicians, therapists, researchers, teachers and more, making a difference in patients' lives. Your skill and compassion can make us even stronger.


Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Data Analyst and Coordination Specialist (SY22-23)
Description:
Position Overview




Under the leadership of the Director of Enrollment Operations, the Data Analyst & Coordination Specialist serves as a point person for data collection & coordination as it relates to specific state and federal annual reporting.




Our team is in the process of evolving our compliance reporting to be an incremental process throughout the reporting period, rather than an end of period reconciliation. We need to add a motivated team member that is interested in facilitating this change and can help stakeholders understand and adopt new practices for better data quality.




A successful candidate will be able to understand state & federal agency data requirements, and be able to help the team map those needs to the stakeholder processes. The Data Analyst and Coordination Specialist will need to be a leader who can work with multiple stakeholders at the central, school-level, and state level and train business users on the business, data governance, and system rules that lead to accurate and timely data collection.




Moving validation and data quality earlier in the process means system users will need new and better tools so they can remain productive. The Data Analyst and Coordination Specialist will need to help create processes and guides for the system users to help them stay productive.




Responsibilities




Collaborate with key district and school stakeholders on the completion and incremental progress towards the SCS, and support with: SSDR, SIMS, EPIMS, Civil Rights Reports
Provide summary report to ODA for sign-off before final submission
Work with other central departments, like ODA, to support analyses of longitudinal district data to ensure accuracy of state and federally reported data
Support the ongoing and annual reporting of key performance indicators and metrics for the district
Support team members with annual user trainings focused on appropriate and accurate use of the SIS
Support ad hoc data requests for key internal stakeholders as needed
Curate existing quick reference guides and create guides and handbooks, when needed, to provide users with ongoing access to technical assistance
Support Director of Enrollment Operations with process change designs and rollouts
Collaborate with Data Team members on the cleaning and maintenance of accurate data in core database systems. Will need to learn about internal data stores including legacy and new Ed-Fi repositories.
Identifies and corrects logical incongruences, gaps, or obvious errors before final submissions
Other duties as needed and assigned




Qualifications - Required




Bachelor's degree in a related field
Demonstrated skill and experience in data analysis and reporting, ideally within an educational setting
Strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills
Understanding of Massachusetts K­12 public school systems and education data. Previous experience preferred.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Very strong data manipulation skills, using accessible systems (Excel, SQL, etc)
Deep understanding of the importance of strong data governance, quality and completeness




Qualifications - Preferred




Experience in BPS and BPS Data
Experience and understanding of various K-12 Data standards like CEDS and Ed-Fi
Experience with Student Information Systems like Aspen
Familiarity with Data Analytics tools like PowerBI




Terms: Managerial, C51.




The Boston Public Schools, in accordance with its nondiscrimination policies, does not discriminate in its programs, facilities, or employment or educational opportunities on the basis of race, color, age, criminal record (inquiries only), disability, homelessness, sex/gender, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, genetics or military status, and does not tolerate any form of retaliation, or bias-based intimidation, threat or harassment that demeans individuals’ dignity or interferes with their ability to learn or work.

Title: Data Analyst (SQL/ Tableau)

Job#: 1317383

Job Description:

Apex Systems has an opportunity for a Data Analyst.This is a 6+ month contract to hire and the pay rate is flexible depending on experience. Here are the details:

For applicants who are interested in the Data Analyst Opportunity; please send a Word resume to Aliya Mcknight at apmcknight@apexsystems.com

Position: Data Analyst

Location: Remote (EST)

Rate: Negotiable based on experience

Duration: 6+ month contract to hire

Position Description:

Looking for:

A senior data analyst who has experience managing 1-2 junior tableau developers and analysts and is also an individual contributor. Min 7+ years experience


Skillsets:

Expert in SQL and Tableau dashboard development. Should be able to work with complex joins using SQL

Experience working in digital analytics and marketing analytics dataset

Experience in creating member touchpoint journey using data from various digital sources and generating insights

Someone who can create/write jira stories for junior analysts

Good to have Business intelligence experience

Having python data analysis experience, a plus

Understands business use cases and who can translate them in technical definitions

Who can meet deadlines and communicate updates to senior leadership effectively

Minimum 7 Years Of Analytics Experience

Minimum of 7 years of analytics experience
Experience working in digital analytics and marketing analytics dataset
Expert in SQL and Tableau dashboard development. Should be able to work with complex joins using SQL


Nice to Haves:

Good to have Business intelligence experience
Having python data analysis experience, a plus
Any health-care/ health-insurance background

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A little about us...

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 750 clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world.
We provide our employees with a learning environment that promotes growth and creativity.
To learn more please visit us at https://www.ltimindtree.com/Twitter @ https://twitter.com/ltimindtree

Job Details:

Will provide advice on data gathering, test creation and data analysis related to acquisition, cross-sell and upsell campaigns (including experimental campaigns)
Expertise in querying databases with SQL/Python, data manipulation/trending/analysis
Experience with hypothesis testing is required
Knowledge of digital analytics (Adobe/Google) and data lake/visualization systems (Snowflake/Sisense) required
Non-profit experience desirable
Will work under the direction of Supporter Centric Delivery Data Scientist

How will you grow?

Role-based Training programs
Continuing Education Programs (CEP) to enhance your knowledge, skills, and attitude as a professional.
We encourage you to acquire various beneficial international certifications, with costs s reimbursed.
Our role-based workshop helps us groom future leaders for LTI.

What's in it for you?

Excellent benefits plan: medical, dental, vision, life, FSA, & PTO
Roll over vacation days
Commuter benefits
Excellent growth and advancement opportunities
Certification reimbursement
Rewards and recognition programs
Innovative and collaborative company culture

We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for people passionate about data and motivated by solving problems in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment. Altrio is a fast-growing technology company, where Data Analyst have abundant opportunities for learning and career advancement. As an early member of our team, you will play a vital role in shaping Altrio’s Data and Research team and be part of an exciting journey to modernize the $10 trillion dollar global real estate investment industry.

Here are some of the things you’ll spend your time doing:

Analyze, interpret and extract data from financial models (Excel and Argus), Offering Memorandums and/or any other documents
Collect, normalize, validate and structure incoming data
Work with the product and engineering team to onboard third-party data providers
Support the Customer Success team with data migration when onboarding new clients
Conduct secondary research and update a proprietary database using various sources that include: news articles, press releases, internet research, surveys, and/or direct discussions with service providers
Ad-hoc data and research project


Requirements

Comprehensive understanding of commercial real estate fundamentals
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Advanced proficiency with Excel
Ability to work in a fast-paced, relatively unstructured environment
Commercial real estate brokerage experience is an asset
Great communication and time management skills
Ability to work independently and proactively


Nice to have

Commercial real estate brokerage experience is an asset
Data visualization knowledge and skills (Tableau, PowerBI, Python)


Benefits

In addition, we offer health coverage (with a health care spending account) and an annual education stipend.

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description:
Job purpose

Analyze information needs of all stakeholders who consume marketing data to design relevant reports and generate insights. Build and manage automated and manual reports and dashboards solutions to aggregate data from multiple data partners and sources, understand key trends and opportunities, and visualize information for intended audience. Identify opportunities for enhancing internal processes and utilizing appropriate technology solutions.




Duties and responsibilities

Create basic measurement plan to define approach, methodology, and metrics using business and marketing data for identifying trends, insights, marketing results and answers to key business questions
Design business analytics dashboards, reports, and presentations appropriate for intended audience
Create and deliver ad hoc analyses to support business planning and other client needs
Work closely with strategists, account, and data-tech teams to develop POVs and proposals as needed
Implement and execute processes to ensure quality of data used for analysis
Work with technology team to create databases to aggregate data and automate ETL and calculations as required
Comply with all AODA regulations and requirements
Ensure adherence to all company policies and procedures including health and safety




Qualifications

Degree in a quantitative (ie Math, Engineering, CS) and/or marketing-related field preferred
Quantitative & analytical with strong attention to detail
Ability to translate data into actionable business insights, with excellent communication skills to present findings to stakeholders verbally and through presentations/visualizations
Understanding of research, analytical and statistical methodologies and metrics, and their application to business measurement
Working knowledge of marketing channels, including media (digital and offline), web, email, direct mail, etc. and their success factors
Some training or experience with business analytics tools. For example:
Web analytics platforms (Google Analytics, Adobe, etc.)
SQL database (MS SQL, Oracle, mySQL, etc.)
Visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)
Statistical software (SAS, R, etc.)
Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Naturally curious, up to date with industry trends
Team player







NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.




The Company welcomes and encourages applications from people with visible and non-visible disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruiting and selection process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

You will work in the Mobile Central Technology (MCT) organization with Business Intelligence, Growth Engineering, and Security teams. You will report to the Director of Mobile BI Technology.

This job is hybrid remote within the region of Toronto, ON.

Responsibilities

You will construct tables and views from multiple data sources, to enable key decision-making around campaign performance, player behavior, and game security.
You will respond to changes in the capabilities of our business partners, each with processes to generate data to be organized into clear signals that enable effective decision-making.
Technical Skills

Build dashboards in Looker and other data visualizing data tools
Write advanced SQL, including using partitions and windowing functions
Design data visualizations that follow best practice principles
Measure the performance of marketing campaigns
Measure the lifecycle of players
Organize data into facts and dimensions
Soft Skills

Responsive
Ownership
Documenter
Learner

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We believe that everyone has the right to DEFINE themselves and their future.




That includes YOU.




How would you like to do it in a fun, high-performance culture that’s truly one of a kind – on a team that appreciates you for being you, helps our members retire with confidence and makes Canada better, all at the same time?




If that sounds like your thing – and you’re an exceptional Data Analyst – we’d like to hear from you.




We’re CAAT Pension Plan, and we’re growing. We innovate defined benefit (DB) pension plans. What are they? Unlike other pension plans, they specifically define the lifetime benefits our members will receive in retirement. This means that our members know exactly what they’re getting every month – for life! Because we provide that certainty, we help more Canadians retire with greater financial security and priceless peace of mind and take pressure off the social safety net at the very same time, which frees up those resources for other Canadians who really need them.




The Data Analyst’s primary focus will be data management and reporting to assist the Pension Solutions team in proactively managing relationships with external organizations and reporting on activities. The role provides additional support performing research and documenting processes as required.




The role works closely with and under the guidance of the Senior Data Analyst and Manager, Pension Solutions, collaborating with the team’s research analysts and co-op students in a fast-paced environment with concurrent deliverables.




We are looking for someone with the following attributes:




Relevant program in community college or university such as data management, data analytics, statistics, etc.
Attention to accuracy and detail is a must.
Proficiency in the full Microsoft Office Suite (MS 365 preferred) with excellent Excel skills.
Aptitude in resourcefulness and thinking out-of-the-box.
Previous experience working with Salesforce or other CRM tool(s), and/or Power BI would be an asset.
Pension plan, group benefits or labour relations experience would be an asset.
Ability to write and communicate clearly.




Once here you will:




Maintain, process, and analyze stakeholder data and information with high attention to detail.
Investigate CRM tool improvements and work with the appropriate teams for the tool’s development.
Work on standard methodologies, best practices, and implementing improvements to the CRM tool(s) to improve department efficiency.
Liaise with internal teams on projects, initiatives, training, and documentation.
Perform research on organizations and individuals to fill in data gaps.
Assist with research on organizations and individuals, following templates and using a range of identified data sources.
Demonstrate, support, and encourage the CAAT values of integrity, teamwork and impact.
Demonstrate, support, and encourage the pillars of our organizational culture, including respect and trust, energy and optimism, open communication, promoting growth and well-being.
Other duties as assigned.







What does CAAT offer you and what should you know about us?




Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their whole, authentic selves to work. That’s what drives our high-performance, fun culture – one that’s truly one of a kind. In fact, we have been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2019, 2020, 2021, and 2022, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2020, 2021, 2022 & 2023 and by Canadian HR Reporter as one of the Best Places to Work for 2021.
We provide (no big surprise here!) membership in CAAT’s defined benefit (DB) pension plan, a flexible and friendly work environment, a comprehensive health and dental benefits package, life insurance, and an array of wellness programs
Everyone is a leader at CAAT, so we invest in our people and enthusiastically support your career development goals, regardless of your role, with access to tuition aid and learning opportunities like our ground-breaking CAAT Academy
We are conveniently located at the Eaton Centre in downtown Toronto, next to Queen Subway station, with ready access to multiple TTC routes, GO Transit, and the PATH.
We offer a flexible, hybrid work arrangement.
You can learn more at www.caatpension.ca




DEFINITELY INTERESTED? Apply on LinkedIn or email your resume to careers@caatpension.ca on or before February 1, 2023 with Data Analyst in the subject line.




We recruit and select the most qualified candidates and thank all applicants for their interest. Only those considered for an interview will be contacted.




CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer that supports abilities and diversity of all kinds. If you require accommodation during the recruiting and selection process, please contact us at hr@caatpension.ca or call Human Resources at 416-673-9000.
